question: Which of the following statements are correct regarding inbound and outbound rules when adding security rules to a security group? (Choose two)

answers.A: An inbound rule consists of the traffic source and the destination port (or port range). The source may be another security group, a single IP address, or an IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.
answers.B: An outbound rule contains the traffic destination and the destination port (or port range). The destination may be another security group, a single IP address, or an IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.
answers.C: An inbound rule consists of the traffic destination and the destination port (or port range). The source may be another security group, a single IP address, or an IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.
answers.D: An outbound rule contains the traffic source and the destination port (or port range). The destination may be another security group, a single IP address, or an IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR block.
